page.title: 19Industry - Mossmorran(contd)
page.content: an excellent choice. An area of flat, relatively poor farmland was exactly what the companies were looking for. The farmers in the area sold their land to Mossmorran. The people living in the small housing estate, Graypark, in the area were rehoused in a new estate on the margins of Cowdenbeath. These were the only stumbling blocks over which the companies easily overleaped. The major asset of course, and the reason that the site was chosen, was its proximity to the deep waters at Braefoot Bay, where the propane, butane and natural gasoline must be piped. There is a proposed route of loading line which is to run directly from the plant to Braefoot Bay. Tankers are easily able to reach the Braefoot Bay loading facilities of /
